seo.title: About SustainSage
seo.description: Meet the coaches behind SustainSage and understand the ethics, cultural care, and real-life impact of our practice.

hero.title: Steady coaching partners who honour context
hero.subtitle: We hold calm, bilingual conversations so you can think clearly without performance.

mission.title: What guides us
mission.description: Our practice is rooted in consent, cultural literacy, and accountability.
bullets: ICF-aligned ethics: confidentiality, informed consent, and transparent agreements.
Attention to migration, race, gender, class, and health realities in every session.
Partnership over prescriptionsâ€”we notice patterns with you and co-design next steps.

roots.title: Where we come from
roots.description: SustainSage grew from relocating across continents, rebuilding careers, and supporting communities navigating change.
bullets: Coaching leaders, migrants, and carers across Asia-Pacific, Europe, and the UK.
Backgrounds in service design, social innovation, and organisational learning.
Practice shaped by multilingual facilitation and trauma-aware safeguarding partnerships.

cards.title: ICF ethics in action
cards.body: We agree on boundaries, confidentiality, data handling, and review points before sessions begin.

cards.title: Non-directive partnership
cards.body: You choose the focus and pace. We reflect patterns, invite questions, and offer structure without prescribing.

cards.title: Culturally responsive and practical
cards.body: We welcome multiple languages, identities, and systems. Conversations end with grounded experiments you consent to test.

practice.title: How coaching feels
practice.description: We balance structure with room to adapt so your lived reality stays central.
bullets: We clarify boundaries, pace, language, and consent for information use together.
Sessions weave reflection with practical planning you choose.
We review progress regularly and close well, including signposting if coaching is no longer the right fit.

boundaries.title: Clear limits keep you safe
boundaries.description: Naming what we do not provide protects your agency and wellbeing.
bullets: Coaching is not therapy, counselling, medical, legal, financial, or immigration advice.
We are not an emergency or crisis service, nor a safeguarding investigation team.
We do not act on behalf of employers or sponsors without your explicit consent.

snapshots.title: Real-world snapshots
snapshots.intro: Names and details are blended to protect privacy while showing what coaching can feel like.

cards.title: Relocation and belonging
cards.context: A professional who moved from Taipei to Manchester felt stretched between supporting family abroad and learning UK workplace norms.
cards.support: We mapped support networks, rehearsed boundary-setting scripts, and designed experiments for building local community at a humane pace.
cards.result: They left with language for naming capacity, clearer agreements with relatives, and steadier confidence in hybrid meetings.

cards.title: Return-to-work clarity
cards.context: A parent re-entering paid work after caregiving wanted to honour both career hopes and new family rhythms.
cards.support: We explored values, noticed inherited narratives about productivity, and co-created weekly check-ins with their partner.
cards.result: They reported feeling more in charge of choices, with shared agreements and realistic markers of progress.

cards.title: UK workplace confidence
cards.context: A manager from Singapore navigated fast UK feedback styles and worried about being perceived as quiet.
cards.support: We practised grounding techniques, prepared questions to invite clarity, and identified allies who value reflective pacing.
cards.result: They described greater ease in speaking up, plus practical experiments to keep learning without abandoning their voice.
